title: ERROR: Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.comcast.net timed out. Try again.
content: Email from my Comcast.net will not send (see error message above in Subject. I CAN send emails on my gmail account. WHAT’S WRONG?
creator: marck31

title: e mail
content: my dads Thunderbird email is not loading any mail ??
creator: dnewman1500

title: Image attachments in messages.
content: Is there a way to disable Thunderbird’s ability to open email attachments (image attachments currently)? We’re no stranger to message spam, or how message remote content can be abused, but images can still display fraudulent content. I’m hoping the images don’t contain any other surprises. Thank you for your time.
creator: Sgoti

title: New T'bird release
content:
I positively DESPISE the new Thunderbird. 1) I cannot view my my emails in the manner that has worked so well for over 20 years. 2) In order to see the new emails, I have to scroll past 3 billion old emails to see the newest ones. 3) Even worse, if I don't delete the current viewed email, I have to scroll to the left, past the 3 billion old emails (that I have to save and have current, to get to the "origin" so that I can click on the NEXT ONE TO READ!. 4) I can no longer get T'bird to throw away 'banned' senders that were previously automatically moved to the 'junk' pile without my having to waste time dealing with their ads yet AGAIN. 5) Can't seem to get emails sorted by date, subject or what have you like before.

I want my old T'bird interface back.

David Merchant (ainut@hiwaay.net & ainut2@hiwaay.net)
creator: ainut

title: Update 138 now requires Primary Password
content:
I upgraded to update 138. Thunderbird now requires me to enter a Primary Password. I never set a primary password. I cannot send, receive, or make any changes to Thunderbird.

How do I get out of this situation?
creator: dan.delvillano
